3328c029-3744-4abf-804e-b35275ffe2d3.description: The badge earner has demonstrated the following competencies: Understands how race was constructed in the US, informed about LatinX history in the US, knowledgeable about the process by which implicit bias is formed, able to explain how bias impacts health disparities, and employs evidence-based interventions to decreasing one's own bias.
3328c029-3744-4abf-804e-b35275ffe2d3.name: Hennepin Healthcare Compass Program: Attendee

badge_template_activities.title: Proven and demonstrated ability to understand the mechanisms of Implicit Bias. Acquired knowledge on the ways in which human brains are designed to be most efficient, how that leads to stereotypes and bias, and the overall impact on health equity. Established concrete, practical, evidence-based approaches to decreasing your bias.
Participants will complete pre/mid/post programmatic assessments as well as instructor-led course evaluations.

Participants are immersed in a health equity training that combines instructor-led sessions, including self-led activities such as online learning assignments, self-reflection, and discussions with others in their cohorts to discuss and reflect on what they are learning.

048c2bb9-eda8-451b-b490-b223ab8dc9f4.description: Builds onto acquired skills and knowledge in module 2. The badge earner has demonstrated the following competencies: Knowledgeable about different forms of systematic racism, informed about Asian American history in the United States, understands how historical trauma can show up in health outcomes, completely describes the human design to survive, identify the breaking point in the human body, and able to explain the construct of race and systematic forms of racism.
048c2bb9-eda8-451b-b490-b223ab8dc9f4.name: Hennepin Healthcare Compass Program: Accomplice

badge_template_activities.title: Knowledgeable about the multifaceted forms of structural racism and the significance of inclusion and belonging. Able to take knowledge related to history of racism, the formation of bias, navigating conversations on race to start implementing systemic change. Able to make connections between strength/resilience and the breaking point of a human body and apply it to their daily lives and work.
Participants will complete pre/mid/post programmatic assessments as well as instructor-led course evaluations.

Participants are immersed in a health equity training that combines instructor-led sessions, including self-led activities such as online learning assignments, self-reflection, and discussions with others in their cohorts to discuss and reflect on what they are learning.

72cac165-70f6-4dcb-a1d8-038feaffc277.description: The badge earner is someone who promotes and enables change to happen within any group or organization. Builds onto acquired skills and knowledge in module 3. The badge earner has demonstrated the following competencies: Deeply knowledgeable about Black/African American history in the United States, recognize microaggressions, differentiate between micro and macro aggressions, discuss evidence-based methods of intervening with microaggressions, and skilled in addressing microaggressions.
72cac165-70f6-4dcb-a1d8-038feaffc277.name: Hennepin Healthcare Compass Program: Advisor

badge_template_activities.title: Knowledgeable about the multifaceted forms of structural racism and the significance of inclusion and belonging. Able to take knowledge related to history of racism, the formation of bias, navigating conversations on race to start implementing systemic change. Able to make connections between strength/resilience and the breaking point of a human body and apply it to their daily lives and work.
Participants will complete pre/mid/post programmatic assessments as well as instructor-led course evaluations.

Participants are immersed in a health equity training that combines instructor-led sessions, including self-led activities such as online learning assignments, self-reflection, and discussions with others in their cohorts to discuss and reflect on what they are learning.

deb0a06b-1dd6-4256-b9ac-0cb4b2077dc7.description: Builds onto acquired skills and knowledge in module 1. The badge earner has demonstrated the following competencies: Awareness of common reactions in people of color and white people when talking about race and racism, demonstrate effective communication skills when discussing an emotionally charged topic such as racism, understands best practices when engaging or facilitating conversations on race, informed about Native American history.
deb0a06b-1dd6-4256-b9ac-0cb4b2077dc7.name: Hennepin Healthcare Compass Program: Ambassador

badge_template_activities.title: Acquired skills in successfully navigating conversations on race. Demonstrated enhanced self-awareness. Experienced in self-reflection to increase emotional intelligence, metacognition, and processing skills. Proven ability to think through varying and sometimes conflictual perspectives.
Participants will complete pre/mid/post programmatic assessments as well as instructor-led course evaluations.

Participants are immersed in a health equity training that combines instructor-led sessions, including self-led activities such as online learning assignments, self-reflection, and discussions with others in their cohorts to discuss and reflect on what they are learning.
